description: From Efik mbakara or Ibibio mbakara; compare Gullah buckra (“white person”).

examples: As he was going to the stake, he turned about, and addressed himself to Mr. Jeffreys  […]  and said, “Buckra, you see me now, but to-morrow I shall be like that,” kicking up the dust with his foot.

entries.meaning: (dated, now rare, African-American Vernacular, derogatory) A poor white person.
examples: “Dunno whether he been a buckra or not,” responded, doggedly, my Cerberus in uniform; “but I’s bound to keep him here till de corporal ob de guard come.”
